title: High School - English Language Development and Acquisition (ELDA)
subject: Spanish Language Arts and Reading (2017-)

document.title: TEXAS ESSENTIAL KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS FOR SPANISH LANGUAGE ARTS AND READING AND ENGLISH AS A SECOND LANGUAGE

1C7A38E525A640269022316720551665.description: compare and contrast coverage of the same event in various media such as newspapers, television, documentaries, blogs, and the internet.

419F9A0C64E647ACBC189CBF10E21A04.description: discover, organize, and support in writing what is known and what needs to be learned about a topic; and

36AB7EA2AE834F82B8E287CF00AB641B.description: locate appropriate print and non-print information using texts and technical resources, periodicals, and the internet;

C1A78259899240C9A667F82D6B6E7338.description: Inquiry and research: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts. Students engage in both short-term and sustained recursive inquiry processes for a variety of purposes. Based on the student's language proficiency level, and with appropriately provided English language development scaffolding, the student is expected to:

9F70371EB12F43DA9EDB44731DEE9356.description: use cohesive devices with increasing accuracy.

1F9EE8B97D1949A68372A38E7521D0D0.description: evaluate writing for both mechanics and content; and

94E99FC009914D39A864D279FD1EC92E.description: use study tools, including writing, labeling, and sketching, to clarify and remember information;

53770749119D4D4496DB3A441E475BA0.description: create, revise, edit, and publish using various technology applications;

896D31656C39424384CC135AAFCA6B0F.description: convey intended meaning while recognizing the meanings and uses of the other registers in English that are often expressed through colloquialisms, idioms, and other language forms;

9D5A0BCB0A0E40D2A275709FAB7AD287.description: organize and convert information into different forms such as charts, graphs, and drawings;

F21CA2D2B9DA4253A7CF15A9C2665309.description: compile written ideas to form complete sentences and paragraphs;

6C6A3294C21644968AE312CACFD877AC.description: arrange phrases, clauses, and sentences into correct and meaningful patterns;

177B57BBA2194DFD88B6B602FE42725D.description: apply oral and written conventions in English with increasing fluency during classroom presentations, compositions, and dialogue;

8EF4D9908CDD48829E21D867FA005BF7.description: use prewriting strategies to generate ideas, develop voice, and plan;

BCB380F703B14A33811E819336FA4662.description: demonstrate increasing control over grammatical elements such as subject-verb agreement, pronoun agreement, and verb forms;

4C16199E659740838C4DF3F8BAB13846.description: spell familiar words with increasing accuracy and employ English spelling patterns and rules with increasing accuracy as more English is acquired;

D522525264074DC5859A866EAD6137F3.description: produce legible work that demonstrates increasing accuracy in the use of the English alphabet, spelling, and the correct use of the conventions of punctuation and capitalization;

FF7A30EC716941D984517B775C222025.description: Composition: listening, speaking, reading writing, and thinking using multiple texts. Students use the modes of writing/discourse and the writing process recursively to compose multiple texts that are meaningful and legible and use appropriate conventions. Based on the student's proficiency level, and with appropriately provided English language development scaffolding, the student is expected to:

EC5D957F229C4C5EB62AED9498EA6441.description: determine the purpose of the message.

E85E20E56FDA4A15B33C1D3B564DBBB6.description: determine and interpret an author's or speaker's intended message;

0A569ADC1CCD42519698FAA38F35C916.description: Author's purpose and craft: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts. Students use critical inquiry to analyze the purpose of authors' choices and how they influence and communicate meaning within a text. Students will analyze and apply author's craft purposefully in order to develop their own products and performances. Based on the student's proficiency level, and with appropriately provided English language development scaffolding, the student is expected to:

08091B80CBB44AF58E032F0FBB21CB93.description: compare and contrast how events are presented and information is communicated by visual images such as graphic art, illustrations, or photographs versus non-visual text.

21EC0886C6884B0CB4543FE7F0EDFA6B.description: use text features, including titles, headings, subheadings, paragraphs, fonts, styles, index, glossary, table of contents, and graphics to locate, explain, or use information; and

0B2E3F15694F4B069F82A5E1212F9B26.description: read and listen to adapted or linguistically accommodated modified classical, traditional, contemporary, and multicultural works in English or native language (L1) in alignment with grade-level student expectations;

03999AD3C6C241698558FF1C60B37B47.description: compare characteristics of cultures represented in various linguistic and non-linguistic sources;

8B92C46580B84A878603DBD9B3CCE623.description: Multiple genres: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts. Students recognize and analyze genre-specific characteristics, structures, and purposes within and across increasingly complex traditional, contemporary, classical, and diverse multicultural texts. Based on the student's language proficiency level, and with appropriately provided English language development scaffolding, the student is expected to:

AAF49B2032B046068D573215B1967BD1.description: organize information in a variety of ways such as graphics, conceptual maps, and learning logs.

0F94C1E5E6234D078FBED07F236B1450.description: respond orally to information presented in a wide variety of print, electronic, audio, and visual media to reinforce concept and language attainment; and

9CFF97C9BAEA4F03A978AA8BFF7A8037.description: express opinions, ideas, and feelings ranging from communicating single words and short phrases to participating in short discussions;

8A8550C23B2D44E3B51E1FE7AB88FF52.description: communicate non-verbally to effectively and appropriately engage in formal and social interactions;

C4BF60E509A94986B8170E9C451EC9C2.description: express ideas and feelings such as gratitude, needs, opinion, and greetings;

35739D65042A447FBE4F9DFF8CE2F6AE.description: ask for and give information such as directions, address, name, age, and nationality;

901ABA1F4D8E48E689AED25573CC7749.description: speak using a variety of increasingly complex grammatical structures, sentence lengths, sentence types, and connecting words with increasing accuracy and ease as more English is acquired;

15FFD81F5E66452E9EE885EA8C5DFD63.description: formulate and provide effective verbal and non-verbal feedback;

D2B420695DFE4FFBB12C86DECE2895D8.description: Response skills: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts. Students react and respond to a variety of sources that are read, heard, or viewed. Based on the student's language proficiency level, and with appropriately provided English language development scaffolding, the student is expected to:

95273839ACF84C6BAABBB98C890EA506.description: make inferences and use evidence to support understanding.

80B20192356646E88814FE7EBC939968.description: listen to and derive meaning from a variety of media such as video, DVD, CD, or other technology to build and reinforce concepts and language; and

D5EBFE22C1CF4FB1BDBB2EF779E32F52.description: make connections to personal experiences, ideas in other texts, and the larger community;

3BA310EF94074718BA765E4F503EF479.description: demonstrate comprehension of English by participating in shared reading, responding to questions, and taking notes that are commensurate with language acquisition;

318EE711A5A747D6B66092933967F5FD.description: self-monitor using pre-reading supports such as graphic organizers, illustrations, and pre-taught topic-related vocabulary to enhance comprehension of input from various sources;

FAB6C81BA748454D8AD70E6FC9E07140.description: summarize texts and retell in English or the native language (L1) as needed;

4A4B32BDF8D943D4ACBB260042000F79.description: Comprehension skills: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts. Students use metacognitive skills both develop and deepen comprehension of increasingly complex texts. Based on the student's language proficiency level, and with appropriately provided English language development scaffolding, the student is expected to:

CACDEF02F9D94223B9E85F5769D01B15.description: share prior knowledge with peers and others to facilitate communication and foster respect for others.

8D25B1BC681B4015A5D31E3C6763FA79.description: listen actively and ask relevant questions to clarify understanding; and

173016E4358B432FA83B1D39EFF9D693.description: use print or digital resources such as glossaries, English dictionaries, bilingual dictionaries, thesauri, and available technology to determine meanings and usage;

256EBEA5ACAD49C88750D5C1E2122D7A.description: develop basic sight vocabulary, derive meaning from environmental print, and comprehend English vocabulary and language structures used routinely;

3EA08E52823B4614A2565762B66E7B69.description: identify and use words that name actions, directions, positions, sequences, and locations;

48C5E2E7A7DC4B87BB82C4C9844EA9B7.description: learn relationships between sounds and letters of the English language and decode (sound out) words using a combination of skills such as recognizing sound-letter relationships and identifying cognates, affixes, roots, and base words;

FE47B2FD0C064F0CA5A83FBE37B7CDD3.description: identify people, places, objects, events, and basic concepts such as numbers, days of the week, food, occupations, clothing, colors, and time;

4897327C255541958A81C9186B11DF54.description: understand the general meaning, main points, and important details of spoken language ranging from universally familiar to unfamiliar topics;

3101B2C95DB24AED91500A5EF336FB54.description: process and use basic academic English language interdisciplinary vocabulary;

613C3171876C4F37883C59A7171E7E15.description: develop knowledge of relationships between sounds and letters of the English language to represent sounds when writing in English;

5186E6B0DAFB410CB6DE2ECC696C3B8A.description: recognize print directionality of the English language such as reading left to right or top to bottom;

7C85794AB64C440FADA8B9B36FF11816.description: distinguish and produce sounds and intonation patterns of English;

D51BD4BDC3CC45379D071BC6A79197C4.description: Developing and sustaining foundational language skills: listening, speaking, discussion, and thinking--oral language. Students develop oral language and word structure knowledge through phonological awareness, print concepts, phonics, and morphology to communicate, decode, and encode. Students apply knowledge and relationships found in the structures, origins, and contextual meanings of words. Based on the student's language proficiency level, and with appropriately provided English language development scaffolding, the student is expected to:
